intro: Derderia macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed derderia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, often aromatic foliage. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is known for its tall, slender stems that bear clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained conditions. Its leaves are usually compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Derderia macrocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
